alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 05 at 8:52PM CST until March 05 at 9:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Southeastern Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Northeastern Scott County in east central Iowa... Eastern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 930 PM CST. * At 852 PM CST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage were located along a line extending from near McCausland to near Colona, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Port Byron and Osborn around 855 PM CST. Camanche and Low Moor around 900 PM CST. Albany and East Clinton around 905 PM CST. Clinton, Fulton, Erie and Garden Plain around 910 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Morrison, Prophetstown, Lyndon, Argo Fay, Fairhaven, Tampico, Chadwick, Coleta and Milledgeville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
